item.description:
Dr. Maria H. Loh teaches the history of early modern Italian art and theory at University College,
London. She received her BA in History from McGill University (1993), and her MA and PhD
(2003) from the University of Toronto. She was a predoctoral fellow at the Getty Research Institute
(2000-2002), a junior research fellow at St Hildaâ€™s College Oxford (2003-2004), the recipient of a
Philip Leverhulme Prize (2007-2009), and is currently a Member at the Institute for Advanced Study,
Princeton (2012-2013).

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: A Lecture "Michelangelo, Bandinelli, and Bernini: The Long Goodbye."
